choices.B: The network administrator can apply port security to EtherChannels.
choices.A: The network administrator can apply port security to dynamic access ports.
choices.E: The network administrator can configure static secure or sticky secure MAC addresses in the voice VLAN.
choices.D: When dynamic MAC address learning is enabled on an interface, the switch can learn new addresses, up to the maximum defined.
choices.C: The sticky learning feature allows the addition of dynamically learned addresses to the running configuration.

questions.question_text: A network administrator needs to configure port security on a switch. Which two statements are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
The answer is C &D
The Answer is both C& D

Selected Answer: CD
this should be CD
switch is a multiport hardware connecting different devices.
What is a switch

Selected Answer: CD
A is tricky; it got me confused as well. In Cisco DTP, you have dynamic auto or desirable ports. Ports are in Dynamic Auto by default (passive trunk mode)
Responses CD
we are coming and are bitter dicks
I thought C and D
C.D good
Why is the answer A is wrong? Can anyone explain?

comments.content:
A is tricky; it got me confused as well. In Cisco DTP, you have dynamic auto or desirable ports. Ports are in Dynamic Auto by default (passive trunk mode). Dynamic access ports doesn't exist. You have to configure the ports to access mode before you enable port security.
SW1(config)#interface fa0/1
SW1(config-if)#switchport mode access

questions.question_text: Which command can you enter to view the ports that are assigned to VLAN 20?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer is B

Selected Answer: B
switch show int vlan
B very good

choices.C: It routes the packet to the default route.
choices.A: It broadcasts the packet to each interface on the router.
choices.B: It broadcasts the packet to each network on the router.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
make sense
most suitable answer is D

If there is a default route then surely the router will forward all unknown traffic to there. But if there is no default route in the routing table then the router will discard the packet. In this question we suppose there is no default route in the routing table. Otherwise the question should state it So i would go with D
The correct answer is C.

questions.question_text: How does a router handle an incoming packet whose destination network is missing from the routing table?
In which two formats can the IPv6 address fd15:0db8:0000:0000:0700:0003:400F:572B be written? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: E
Specify IPv6 addresses by omitting leading zeros
Specify IPv6 addresses by using double colons (::) in place of a series of zeros
Here I find only one right answer "E"

Selected Answer: BE
Specify IPv6 addresses by omitting leading zeros
Specify IPv6 addresses by using double colons (::) in place of a series of zeros

Selected Answer: AE
The answer can not be A due to the fact that the last 4 digits of the MAC address is 572B and not 527B.
Ohh so careful. Maybe it just a typo

comments.content: B,C and D are wrong. So it is just a typo.

discussion.content: The answer can not be A due to the fact that the last 4 digits of the MAC address is 572B and not 527B. The answer is E only.
sorri it must be answer D
cisco preference is B

Since the question does not state PVSTP. it must be assumed that it is using standard STP.
This means that all VANS will be using the same route bridge (B)

questions.question_text: Which statement about spanning-tree root-bridge election is true?

choices.A: Every root bridge must reside on the same root switch.
choices.B: Every VLAN must use the same root bridge.
choices.D: Each VLAN must have its own root bridge.
